intro: Persoonia tora, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ghostgum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, often drooping branches and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Persoonia tora is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland areas. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
